intro: Ruschia paucifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is also known as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color. It produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange, often during the summer months. Ruschia paucifolia is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
